answers.answer: Hello,There are a few possibilities which need to be probed in your case. Firstly stress and anxiety, poor communication with your partner, unrealistic sexual expectations which make sex a task rather than a pleasure, negative feelings about non performance, smoking, alcohol and sometimes illicit drugs can also cause loss of sensations while having intercourse. Since you are having regular erections, so the physical structures are functionally working. It can be due to involvement of the nerves with a Peyronie's plaque, post circumcision damage to nerves or some other type of nerve problem.Nerve problems causing a loss of sensation and numbness are not easily treated and hence needs a detailed examination from a neurologist. Thirdly, medical conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart or thyroid conditions, poor circulation, low testosterone, depression, spinal cord injury, peyronie’s disease, nerve damage (for example, from prostate surgery), or neurologic disorders (such as multiple sclerosis or Parkinson's disease) may also cause such loss of feelings after erection. So my suggestion is to consult a urologist/ neurologist and get your blood sugar levels, thyroid function tests, EKG, MRA ( magnetic resonance angiogram) and nerve conduction velocity tests done.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: Hey im a 18 year old male.. I just started having sex with my girlfriend.. and here come the problems.. sex sometimes feels ok and I can ***.. but sometimes I dont have NO feeling while having sex even if my penis is errected.. so I started to search the internet. I found alot of information.. and I think I found the problem but im not sure.. ive been circumsized for 15 years and heard you lose alot of sensitivity because of that.. is that perhaps the problem?but there is another wierd thing about my penis.. there is a "unnormal" skin between the glans and the shaft.. its about half an inch wide when my penis is errected.. if I touch it it actually hurts a bit and doenst feel pleasent at all.. ive always had it but I never really thought or cared about it.. and now I think its not normal ?thanks for your help
title: Sensitivity Penis
